Title: Software Engineer, Platform
Full Description:
The mission of Speechify is to make sure that reading is never a barrier to learning.
Over 30 million people use Speechify’s text-to-speech products to turn whatever they’re reading – PDFs, books, Google Docs, news articles, websites – into audio, so they can read faster, read more, and remember more. Speechify’s text-to-speech reading products include its iOS app, Android App, Mac App, Chrome Extension, and Web App. Google recently named Speechify the Chrome Extension of the Year and Apple named Speechify its App of the Day.
Today, nearly 200 people around the globe work on Speechify in a 100% distributed setting – Speechify has no office. These include frontend and backend engineers, AI research scientists, and others from Amazon, Microsoft, and Google, leading PhD programs like Stanford, high growth startups like Stripe, Vercel, Bolt, and many founders of their own companies.
Overview
The responsibilities of our Platform team include building and maintaining all backend services, including, but not limited to, payments, analytics, subscriptions, new products, text to speech, and external APIs.
This is a key role and ideal for someone who thinks strategically, enjoys fast-paced environments, is passionate about making product decisions, and has experience building great user experiences that delight users.
We are a flat organization that allows anyone to become a leader by showing excellent technical skills and delivering results consistently and fast. Work ethic, solid communication skills, and obsession with winning are paramount.
Our interview process involves several technical interviews and we aim to complete them within 1 week.
What You’ll Do
Design, develop, and maintain robust APIs including public TTS API, internal APIs like Payment, Subscription, Auth and Consumption Tracking, ensuring they meet business and scalability requirements
Oversee the full backend API landscape, enhancing and optimizing for performance and maintainability
Collaborate on B2B solutions, focusing on customization and integration needs for enterprise clients
Work closely with cross-functional teams to align backend architecture with overall product strategy and user experience
An Ideal Candidate Should Have
Proven experience in backend development: TS/Node (required)
Direct experience with GCP and knowledge of AWS, Azure, or other cloud providers
Efficiency in ideation and implementation, prioritizing tasks based on urgency and impact
Preferred: Experience with Docker and containerized deployments
Preferred: Proficiency in deploying high availability applications on Kubernetes
What We Offer
A dynamic environment where your contributions shape the company and its products
A team that values innovation, intuition, and drive
Autonomy, fostering focus and creativity
The opportunity to have a significant impact in a revolutionary industry
Competitive compensation, a welcoming atmosphere, and a commitment to an exceptional asynchronous work culture
The privilege of working on a product that changes lives, particularly for those with learning differences like dyslexia, ADD, and more
An active role at the intersection of artificial intelligence and audio – a rapidly evolving tech domain
Think you’re a good fit for this job?
Tell us more about yourself and why you're interested in the role when you apply.
And don’t forget to include links to your portfolio and LinkedIn.
Not looking but know someone who would make a great fit?
Refer them!
Speechify is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace.
Speechify does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Title: Cloud Platform / Site Reliability Engineer
Full Description:
Supabase is an Open Source and fully remote company building developer tools for databases.
We are seeking an SRE to manage the infrastructure of our Postgres databases. We currently manage over 1M Postgres instances and are growing fast.
You will:
Help build and maintain the Supabase Cloud offering.
Improve our system architecture to reduce costs while balancing security, reliability, and performance.
Work on designing and tracking metrics for platform uptime.
Increase observability into our system by capturing relevant metrics and logs.
Implement and maintain intrusion detection, automated remediation and patch management systems.
Design CI/CD systems to speed up deployments with proper change and release management processes.
Resolve escalated support issues, while also identifying and resolving systemic issues across the platform.
You are:
Experience in designing multi-tenant database solutions, designing for failover, fault-tolerance, and disaster recovery;
5+ years experience in SRE/DevOps/Cloud Infrastructure;
4+ years of experience in building with Golang and Typescript;
Experience in managing large deployments on AWS;
Knowledge of networking;
Experience with Infrastructure as Code tools (Pulumi preferred, Terraform/CDK etc also acceptable)
Experience with being part of on-call rotations for large production systems
We offer
100% remote work from anywhere in the world. No location-based adjustment to your salary.
ESOP (equity ownership in the company)
Autonomous work. We work collaboratively on projects, but you set your own pace.
Health, Vision and Dental benefits. Supabase covers 100% of the cost for employees and 80% for dependents
Tech Allowance for any office setup you need
Annual Education Allowance
Annually run off-sites.
About the team
We're a startup. It's unstructured.
Collectively founded more than 30 startups.
Globally distributed team with more than 30 different nationalities.
We deeply believe in the efficacy of collaborative open source. We support existing communities and tools, rather than building "yet another xx".
We "dogfood" everything. If you use it in your project, we use it in Supabase.
Process
The entire process is fully remote and all communication will happen over email or via video chat.
Once you've submitted your application, the team will review your submission and may reach out for a short screening interview over a video call.
If you pass the screen you will be invited to up to four follow-up interviews.
The calls:
usually take between 20-45 minutes each depending on the interviewer.
most of the time, are all 1:1.
will be with the founders, a member of either the growth or engineering team (depending on the role) and usually one other person from your immediate team or function.
Once the interviews are over, the team will meet to discuss several roles and candidates and may:
ask one or two follow-up questions over email or a quick call.
go directly to making an offer.

Title: Web Scraping Specialist
Full Description:
Web Scraping Specialist
$70k – $140k
Who We Are.
Wynd Labs is an early-stage startup that is on a mission to make public web data accessible for AI through contributions to Grass.
Grass is a network sharing application that allows users to share their unused bandwidth. Effectively, this is a residential proxy network that directly rewards individual residential IPs for the bandwidth they provide. Grass will route traffic equitably among its network and meter the amount of data that each node provides to fairly distribute rewards.
In non-technical terms: Grass unlocks everyone's ability to earn rewards by simply sharing their unused internet bandwidth on personal devices (laptops, smartphones).
This project is for those who lead with initiative and seek to challenge themselves and thrive on curiosity.
We operate with a lean, highly motivated team who revel in the responsibility that comes with autonomy. We have a flat organizational structure, the people making decisions are also the ones implementing them. We are driven by ambitious goals and a strong sense of urgency. Leadership is given to those who show initiative, consistently deliver excellence and bring the best out of those around them. Join us if you want to set the tone for a fair and equitable internet.
The Role.
We are seeking a Web Scraping Specialist who is proficient and brings significant experience in data extraction and web scraping techniques. You will join a small, specialized team and lead efforts to gather and analyze data, optimize scraping processes, and support our vision for a future where Grass plays a crucial role in transforming internet data accessibility.
Who You Are.
Demonstrated ability to extract data from complex websites with minimal supervision, with a portfolio or examples of past projects.
Proficiency in languages such as Python or JavaScript, with strong skills in libraries and frameworks like BeautifulSoup, Scrapy, or Selenium.
Knowledge of asynchronous programming, multithreading, and distributed scraping.
In-depth knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and the Document Object Model (DOM).
Experience with NoSQL databases (MongoDB, Cassandra), capable of designing efficient storage solutions and managing data integrity.
Ability to apply machine learning algorithms for data cleaning, categorization, or predictive analysis adds significant value.
Experience with cloud services (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure) for deploying and managing scraping jobs at scale.
Active participation in open-source projects related to web scraping, data processing, or similar fields.
What You'll Be Doing.
Write, test, and refine code that extracts data from various online sources, ensuring reliability and efficiency.
Perform data retrieval tasks, handling complexities such as pagination and dynamic content loaded with AJAX.
Clean and format extracted data, ensuring it meets quality standards for further analysis or processing.
Database management: Store and manage the scraped data in appropriate databases, optimizing for access speed and data integrity.
Regularly monitor the scraping processes, identify and resolve any issues to maintain continuous data flow.
Why Work With Us.
Opportunity. We are at at the forefront of developing a web-scale crawler and knowledge graph that allows ordinary people to participate in the process, and share in the benefits of AI development.
Culture. We’re a lean team working together to achieve a very ambitious goal of improving access to public web data and distributing the value of AI to the people. We prioritize low ego and high output.
Compensation. You’ll receive a competitive salary and equity package.

Title: Member Lifecycle Marketing Associate
Full Description:
About Carrot:
Carrot Fertility is the leading global fertility, family-building, and lifelong hormonal healthcare platform providing care for everyone, everywhere. Trusted by more than a thousand multinational employers, health plans, and health systems, Carrot's comprehensive clinical program delivers industry-leading cost savings for employers and award-winning experiences for millions of people worldwide. From maternity through menopause and pre-pregnancy through parenting, Carrot is dedicated to expanding access and improving outcomes. Carrot empowers members with compassionate, personalized, and inclusive support.
The Role:
We’re looking for a collaborative, detail-oriented, highly organized Member Lifecycle Marketing Associate to join our team. In this role, you’ll play a critical part in scaling and optimizing our member lifecycle program – ensuring our members receive timely, personalized communications that guide them in getting the most out of their Carrot benefit.
You’ll manage day-to-day operations across lifecycle marketing, including tracking and executing cross-functional project workflows; developing and maintaining trackers, documentation, and calendars; coordinating stakeholder communication; and owning operational email requests from intake through launch. You’ll be a key partner in QA across email, SMS, and push channels by working closely with Marketing Operations and other teams to help ensure an accurate, error-free experience, and contribute to ongoing analysis by pulling and organizing performance data from our reporting tools.
Success in this role is a well-organized, smoothly run lifecycle program that delivers meaningful, well-timed communications that are customized to where members are in their experience. This is a great opportunity for someone early in their marketing career to gain hands-on experience in lifecycle marketing while collaborating closely with marketing operations, content, product, and data teams to bring impactful work to life.
The Team:
Reporting to the Member Lifecycle Marketing Manager, this role is part of the B2C Growth Engagement marketing team focused on delivering timely, personalized communications to help members understand their Carrot benefit and how to get the most out of it for their unique needs. It partners closely with cross-functional teams, including Marketing Operations, Customer Success, Member Success, Data, and Product to help ensure lifecycle programs are accurate, effective, and scalable across the member experience.
Minimum Qualifications:
2–4 years of professional experience in lifecycle, email, or other marketing roles — preferably in B2C health benefits, wellness, or regulated consumer tech
Experience partnering closely with Marketing Operations or technical teams on campaign setup, testing (QA), and email production workflows; familiarity with CRM or campaign execution tools
Experience playing a key role in QA for marketing campaigns to review audience logic, dynamic content, links, UTMs, and send timing
Project coordination or project management experience—especially in cross-functional environments involving marketing, product, data, or content stakeholders
Comfortable working with tools such as Airtable, Asana, Jira, or similar project tracking systems to coordinate multi-step collaborative projects
Familiarity with email marketing tools or CRM platforms (e.g., Blueshift, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Campaign.io, or similar), and working with complex segmentation or personalization logic
Able to organize and work with performance data through experience pulling reports and metrics from platforms like Tableau, DOMO, or Google Sheets/Excel for tracking and analysis
Demonstrates curiosity and an interest in growing in areas related to lifecycle marketing, whether through campaign operations, strategy, personalization, or cross-functional collaboration
Communicates clearly and confidently across teams, with a willingness to ask questions, openly bring up potential issues early, and share thoughtful ideas for improvement
Comfortable diving into the details and handling foundational work that ensures nothing slips through the cracks, so the team can operate efficiently and effectively
Highly organized and able to manage multiple projects and deadlines at once, with strong attention to detail and a proactive approach to identifying and helping resolve issues early
Preferred Qualifications:
Hands-on experience executing email campaigns, journey flows, audience segments, or dynamic content in CRM or email platforms.
Experience creating or evolving trackers, documentation systems, or project calendars to support operationally complex marketing programs
Understanding of personalization strategies in CRM programs, such as dynamic content blocks, conditional logic, Liquid, or lifecycle journey mapping
Experience managing or coordinating translated marketing content across multiple languages and regions
Familiarity with A/B testing and hypothesis-driven email experimentation
Experience helping to scale lifecycle programs and optimizing newsletters to drive conversions
Familiarity with B2C health, wellness, or benefits-related industries
Compensation:
Carrot offers a holistic Total Rewards package designed to support our employees in all aspects of their life inside and outside of work, including health and wellness benefits, retirement savings plans, short- and long-term incentives, parental leave, family-forming assistance, and a competitive compensation package. The starting base salary for this position will range from $100,000.00 - $115,000.00. Actual compensation may vary from posted base salary depending on your confirmed job-related skills and experience.
Fraud and Security Notice: Please note that all communication regarding job opportunities at Carrot will come exclusively from an @get-carrot.com email address. If you receive messages from any other domain, please disregard them and report the incident to: securityreporting@get-carrot.com
Why Carrot?
Carrot has received national and international recognition for its pioneering work, including Fast Company's Most Innovative Companies and World Changing Ideas, Inc. Power Partners, and Modern Healthcare’s Innovators. Carrot’s global workforce has been acknowledged with several accolades, including Fortune’s Best Workplaces in Healthcare, Great Place to Work, and Age-Friendly Employer certifications. Carrot is regularly featured in media reporting on issues related to the future of work, women in leadership, and healthcare innovation, including MSNBC, The Economist, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, CNBC, National Public Radio, Harvard Business Review, and more. Learn more at carrotfertility.com.

Title: Project Coordinator (Design & Development) | Remote, Contract
Senior DevOps Engineer
Full Description:
S-PRO, a top-tier Digital Innovation and Software Engineering company. We specialise in providing cutting-edge services for fast-growing businesses and enterprises, with a strong focus on Finance, Renewable Energy and Healthcare domains and expertise in AI, Blockchain and Data Science. Our team of over 200 dedicated professionals works tirelessly across our global offices to develop innovative digital solutions that drive sustainable business value and increase our client’s competitiveness in a dynamic digital landscape.
We are seeking a Senior DevOps Engineer with strong expertise in cloud infrastructure, automation, and infrastructure-as-code. This role requires independent ownership of tasks from design to deployment, with an emphasis on architecture, planning, and execution.
Requirements
Responsibilities
Design and implement infrastructure solutions on AWS and Azure
Develop and manage infrastructure using Terraform
Create and maintain CI/CD pipelines (GitLab CI, Jenkins)
Build scalable and reliable infrastructure using containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)
Perform scripting and automation (Bash, Python, or similar)
Conduct infrastructure assessments and propose improvements
Independently lead and deliver infrastructure projects end-to-end
Perform incident investigations and implement sustainable solutions
Preferred Qualifications
Deep knowledge of Terraform, AWS services (Azure is a big plus), and GitLab CI
Experience working with microservices and container orchestration (Kubernetes)
Strong understanding of system design and cloud architecture
Proven ability to manage tasks autonomously and operate in low-support environments
Familiarity with monitoring, logging, and alerting systems
Benefits and perks:
Flexible schedule.
Remote work model.
Medical insurance.
Paid vacations.
Paid Sick-leaves.
Paid State holidays.

Title: (Senior) Network Engineer – SONiC
Full Description:
We are seeking a skilled and driven Network Engineer with deep expertise in SONiC (opensource NOS) to join our growing infrastructure team. This is a key position as we begin the implementation and integration of SONiC-based whitebox switching into our datacenter environments. You'll work closely with the Network Engineering Lead and initially with support from our senior architect Marek, helping to shape our next-generation network stack.

Why this role matters
This is a new position created to support our strategic move toward open networking. SONiC will play a critical role in our datacenter operations, and we need an engineer who can take the lead on implementation, hardware selection, troubleshooting, and integration into our existing stack. You'll also be responsible for ensuring production readiness by applying patches, working with the community for hotfixes, and supporting automation.
Design, implement, and maintain datacenter network topologies using SONiC on whitebox hardware.
Troubleshoot complex network issues and ensure high availability, scalability, and reliability across the network stack.
Automate configuration management and network operations using Ansible, Python, and Bash.
Manage the full SONiC firmware lifecycle: patching, upgrading, testing, and contributing to the open-source community.
Select, evaluate, and maintain SONiC-compatible hardware platforms.
Collaborate with infrastructure and engineering teams to integrate SONiC into our broader ecosystem.
Share SONiC expertise internally through documentation, training, and code reviews.
Adapt to evolving priorities and contribute to company-wide infrastructure initiatives.
Must-haves
Proven experience with SONiC: setup, customization, and troubleshooting.
Deep understanding of:
Routing & switching protocols: BGP, EVPN, ECMP, VRF
Network virtualization: VXLAN, GENEVE
Linux networking: network namespaces, bridges, veth pairs.
Experience with FRR (Free Range Routing) and Docker
Proficiency in scripting and coding: Python, Bash, C/C++
Experience with Ansible for network configuration and automation.
Nice-to haves
Exposure to OpenStack networking components (OVN, OVS).
Familiarity with RoCE (RDMA over Converged Ethernet) technologies.
Experience in distributed or remote-first engineering teams.
Contributions to open-source networking projects or forums.
The opportunity to lead cutting-edge networking initiatives in a fast-scaling company.
Ownership of the SONiC integration strategy across our datacenters.
Remote-friendly setup with occasional travel (if desired).
Competitive compensation and benefits in a technically forward-thinking team.

Title: Lead Sales Engineer, Enterprise
Full Description:
From Fivetran’s founding until now, our mission has remained the same: to make access to data as simple and reliable as electricity. With Fivetran, customer data arrives in their warehouses, canonical and ready to query, with no engineering or maintenance required. We’re proud that more organizations continue to leverage our technology every day to become truly data-driven.
About the Role
Fivetran is building data pipelines to power the modern data stack for thousands of companies.
We’re looking for a talented French speaking Lead Sales Engineer to join our Enterprise sales team. As an Enterprise Sales Engineer, you will work closely with our sales team to understand our Enterprise customers’ complex business needs and showcase how Fivetran’s data replication solutions can help them achieve their desired business outcomes. You will be responsible for providing technical expertise, identifying technical requirements, and ensuring a successful proof-of value throughout the sales cycle
This is a full time position based in Dublin, Paris or London.Our hybrid work model offers a blend of remote flexibility and in-person collaboration, including two days in the office each week to connect and build as a team
Technologies You’ll Use
AWS, GCP, Azure, Snowflake, BigQuery, Databricks, New Relic, Linux, Windows, Python, Java
What You’ll Do
Work with Enterprise customers to understand their business, their use cases, and their data replication requirements
Develop and deliver technical presentations to Enterprise audiences
Ensure the technical win by running an organized proof-of-value process
Work closely with multiple cross-fuctional organizations driving change and improvements to Fivetran as a whole.
Work closely with multiple Sales representatives, while maintaining a high level of customer focus and technical excellence
Stay up-to-date on the latest technologies and trends in our industry
Assist team members in advanced technical or business roadblocks
Skills We’re Looking For
Native/Professional Proficiency in French
5+ years in data replication, sales engineering, or related technical field
Strong technical background covering database replication, cloud infrastructure, and data replication technologies with some form of hands on experience
Experience with modern data analytics technologies, including cloud data warehouses, transformation tooling, data catalogs, and BI tools
Excellent communication and presentation skills with a keen ability to explain complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
Experience with Oracle, SQL Server, Postgres, MySQL, and NoSQL databases
Hands on experience with other data replication or ETL tools
Experience with self-hosted software applications and supporting infrastructure
Hands on networking experience both in the cloud and on-premise
Bonus Skills
Experience developing partner relationships
Specialized expertise in security posture
Experience with self-hosted and SaaS software applications
Hands on experience with DBT
Docker/Podman/Kubernetes experience
Perks and Benefits
100% employer-paid medical insurance*
Generous paid time-off policy (PTO), plus paid sick time, inclusive parental leave policy, holidays, and volunteer days off
RSU stock grants*
Professional development and training opportunities
Company virtual happy hours, free food, and fun team-building activities
Monthly cell phone stipend
Access to an innovative mental health support platform that offers personalized care and resources in areas such as: therapy, coaching, and self-guided mindfulness exercises for all covered employees and their covered dependents.
*May vary by country and worker type - please reach out to your recruiter for more information
Click here to learn more about Fivetran's Benefits by Region.
We’re honored to be valued at over $5.6 billion, but more importantly, we’re proud of our core values of Get Stuck In, Do the Right Thing, and One Team, One Dream. Read about us in Forbes.
Fivetran brings together high-quality talent across the globe to make data access as easy and reliable as electricity for our customers. We value and recognize that our customers benefit from having innovative teams made of people from many backgrounds, experiences, and identities. Fivetran promotes diversity, equity, inclusion belonging through attracting, recruiting, developing, and retaining a diverse workforce, not only because it is the right thing to do, but because it helps us build a world-class company to better serve our customers, our people and our communities.
To learn more about Fivetran’s culture and what it’s like to be part of the team, click here and enjoy our video.
To learn more about our candidate privacy policy, you can read our statement here.
We are committed to ensuring that all candidates have an equal opportunity to participate in our interview process. If you require accommodations at any stage of the process due to a disability, medical condition, or any other circumstance, please don't hesitate to submit your request by filling out this form. We will work with you to provide reasonable accommodations to facilitate your participation and ensure a fair and accessible interview experience. Your request and any information provided will be kept confidential and will not impact your candidacy. We look forward to hearing from you and accommodating your needs to the best of our ability.

Title: Marketing Executive - ZR_24617_JOB
Full Description:
This is a remote position.
Working Hours: Monday – Friday | 10:00 AM – 7:00 PM AEST

Experience Required: Minimum 5+ years in digital marketing, venue marketing, and event marketing.

About the Role

Join a fast-paced hospitality marketing team to drive content, reporting, and campaign execution across premium venues in Sydney and Melbourne.

We are seeking an experienced and highly organised Marketing Executive to support our in-house marketing team across digital campaigns, venue
activations, reporting, and content management. This is a hands-on role that requires exceptional attention to detail, strong communication skills, and a proactive mindset to manage multiple moving parts across 8 hospitality venues in Australia.

As an external team member, you will work closely with the internal marketing team to support all campaigns across multiple channels. Communication and task management will be coordinated via email, mobile and project management tools (e.g., Click Up).

This role is suited to a mid-to-senior level marketing specialist who thrives in a fast-paced, remote environment and can confidently manage tasks
independently with minimal supervision.

Key Roles & Responsibilities:

Organic Social Media Management Responsibility: Assist in executing social media strategies and content planning across hospitality venues, ensuring timely delivery, alignment with
brand messaging, and active audience engagement.
Task: Develop and execute tailored content strategies for each venue.
Task: Coordinate with venue content creators to track and manage submissions.
Task: Organise and manage content assets, including user-generated material.
Task: Schedule and publish posts across platforms (e.g., Instagram, Facebook) using approved tools like Loomly.
Task: Monitor post-performance and engagement, suggesting optimisations to boost reach.
Task: Manage community interaction, including comments, messages, and tagged content.
Task: Work with internal teams to maintain visual and messaging consistency.
Task: Assist with monthly reporting on social metrics and content highlights.
EDM Creation & Email Marketing Responsibility: Design and manage email campaigns to engage target audiences.
Task: Create visually appealing EDM (Electronic Direct Mail) templates.
Task: Ensure EDM layouts and messaging align with brand tone and promotions.
Task: Manage and execute email sends via SevenRooms or similar platforms.
Task: Track and report on email performance metrics such as open rates, CTRs, and conversions.

Events & Partnerships
Responsibility: Support logistics and content for venue activations and partner collaborations.
Task: Source collateral and assets for venue activations and partner events.
Task: Liaise with venue and events teams to assist with logistics and preparation.
Task: Coordinate social media posting and report on partner collaboration activities.
Task: Help with event wrap-up reports and data collection.
Marketing Strategy & Planning
Responsibility: Contribute to planning venue campaigns and group marketing strategies.
Task: Assist in creating monthly and yearly event calendars.
Task: Gather data and insights to support wider strategic plans.
Reporting, Data, & Budget Support
Responsibility: Support tracking, reporting, and budget management for campaigns and venues.
Task: Extract data from digital platforms (e.g., Meta, Google Ads, EDM tools) for monthly and campaign reports.
Task: Populate reporting templates for internal teams and brand partners.
Task: Monitor key metrics such as ROI, engagement, and conversions to assess campaign effectiveness.
Task: Maintain marketing budget trackers, ensuring spending aligns with forecasts.
Task: Provide data insights and summaries to inform strategic decisions by the Head of Marketing.
App Management
Responsibility: Handle loyalty and marketing content through customer- facing platforms.
Task: Schedule and manage content via LOKE App (loyalty marketing).
Task: Assist with reviewing and reporting user engagement.
Task: Support basic maintenance documentation for the Whisky App platform.
Photography & Videography Coordination
Responsibility: Oversee creative production across marketing content.
Task: Draft briefs for third-party creators.
Task: Source photographers and videographers as needed.
Printing Coordination
Responsibility: Manage the production and delivery of printed materials.
Task: Coordinate with external and internal teams for printing needs.
Task: Oversee printing schedules and file management for event materials and menus.
Website Updates
Responsibility: Keep campaign-related website content accurate and consistent.
Task: Update campaign content, promotions, and offers.
Task: Ensure banners, landing pages, and promotional areas are aligned with ongoing campaigns.
Task: Upload and format images, graphics, and copy for a professional look.
Task: Work with internal teams and web support on updates.
Coordination with In-Venue Teams
Responsibility: Collaborate with venue teams to execute campaigns effectively.
Task: Liaise with venue staff to gather photos, videos, and creative assets.
Task: Follow up to ensure timely content delivery.
Task: Guide visual quality for in-venue teams.
Task: Assist with internal marketing training modules.
Media Outreach Assistance
Responsibility: Support media engagement through list management and email outreach.
Task: Maintain and update media contact lists.
Task: Send updates to media partners and influencers.
Task: Track responses and update the internal team.
Task: Help coordinate press and media collaborations.

Administrative Support
Responsibility: Provide operational support for the marketing team and venue contacts.
Task: Manage daily email requests for marketing support.
Task: Coordinate with venue teams regarding logistics, menus, and general communication.

Key Skills & Requirements

Non-negotiables:
Minimum 5 years’ experience in digital marketing, venue/ hospitality marketing, and event coordination.
Solid understanding of marketing channels, including social media, email, and app-based platforms.
Experience with website CMS – WordPress
Experience working with hospitality or lifestyle brands.
Confidence in using reporting tools (e.g., Looker Studio, Meta, Google Analytics) and Excel/Google Sheets.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Proactive, resourceful, and well-organised.
Strong knowledge of social media strategy, paid advertising, and performance metrics.
Experience managing budgets, campaign reports, and digital analytics.
Excellent organisational skills with the ability to handle multiple deadlines.
Ability to work independently and across different time zones.
Full-time availability within AEST hours (10 am–7 pm, Mon–Fri).
Nice to Have:
SevenRooms (email marketing tools).
ClickUp or similar task management platforms.
AI platforms such as ChatGPT.
Social media management tools like Loomly.
WordPress Elementor for website content.
Why Join Us?
Be part of a leading hospitality group with venues in Sydney and Melbourne.
Contribute to impactful marketing campaigns across digital, email, and media platforms.
Opportunities for professional growth and long-term collaboration.
Independent Contractor Perks
HMO Coverage in eligible locations
Permanent work from home
Immediate hiring
Steady freelance job

Title: Senior Sales Engineer - Enterprise
Full Description:
From Fivetran’s founding until now, our mission has remained the same: to make access to data as simple and reliable as electricity. With Fivetran, customer data arrives in their warehouses, canonical and ready to query, with no engineering or maintenance required. We’re proud that more organizations continue to leverage our technology every day to become truly data-driven.
About the Role
Fivetran is building data pipelines to power the modern data stack for thousands of companies.
We’re looking for a talented Senior Sales Engineer to join our Enterprise sales team. As an Enterprise Sales Engineer, you will work closely with our sales team to understand our Enterprise customers’ complex business needs and showcase how Fivetran’s data replication solutions can help them achieve their desired business outcomes. You will be responsible for providing technical expertise, identifying technical requirements, and ensuring a successful proof-of value throughout the sales cycle
This is a full time, hybrid position based in Dublin or London. Our hybrid work model offers a blend of remote flexibility and in-person collaboration, including two days in the office each week to connect and build as a team
Technologies You’ll Use
AWS, GCP, Azure, Snowflake, BigQuery, Databricks, Grafana, Linux, Windows, Python, Java
What You’ll Do
Work with Enterprise customers to understand their business, their use cases, and their data replication requirements
Develop and deliver technical presentations to Enterprise audiences
Ensure the technical win by running an organized proof-of-value process
Work closely with multiple cross-fuctional organizations driving change and improvements to Fivetran as a whole.
Work closely with multiple Sales representatives, while maintaining a high level of customer focus and technical excellence
Stay up-to-date on the latest technologies and trends in our industry
Assist team members in advanced technical or business roadblocks
Skills We’re Looking For
5+ years in data replication, sales engineering, or related technical field
Strong technical background covering database replication, cloud infrastructure, and data replication technologies with some form of hands on experience
Experience with modern data analytics technologies, including cloud data warehouses, transformation tooling, data catalogs, and BI tools
Excellent communication and presentation skills with a keen ability to explain complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
Experience with SQL Server, Postgres, MySQL, Oracle and NoSQL databases
Hands on experience with other data replication or ETL tools
Experience with self-hosted software applications and supporting infrastructure
Hands on networking experience both in the cloud and on-premise
Bonus Skills
Experience developing partner relationships
Specialized expertise in security posture
Experience with self-hosted and SaaS software applications
Hands on experience with DBT
Docker/Podman/Kubernetes experience
Perks and Benefits
100% employer-paid medical insurance*
Generous paid time-off policy (PTO), plus paid sick time, inclusive parental leave policy, holidays, and volunteer days off
RSU stock grants*
Professional development and training opportunities
Company virtual happy hours, free food, and fun team-building activities
Monthly cell phone stipend
Access to an innovative mental health support platform that offers personalized care and resources in areas such as: therapy, coaching, and self-guided mindfulness exercises for all covered employees and their covered dependents.
*May vary by country and worker type - please reach out to your recruiter for more information
Click here to learn more about Fivetran's Benefits by Region.
We’re honored to be valued at over $5.6 billion, but more importantly, we’re proud of our core values of Get Stuck In, Do the Right Thing, and One Team, One Dream. Read about us in Forbes.
Fivetran brings together high-quality talent across the globe to make data access as easy and reliable as electricity for our customers. We value and recognize that our customers benefit from having innovative teams made of people from many backgrounds, experiences, and identities. Fivetran promotes diversity, equity, inclusion belonging through attracting, recruiting, developing, and retaining a diverse workforce, not only because it is the right thing to do, but because it helps us build a world-class company to better serve our customers, our people and our communities.
To learn more about Fivetran’s culture and what it’s like to be part of the team, click here and enjoy our video.
To learn more about our candidate privacy policy, you can read our statement here.
We are committed to ensuring that all candidates have an equal opportunity to participate in our interview process. If you require accommodations at any stage of the process due to a disability, medical condition, or any other circumstance, please don't hesitate to submit your request by filling out this form. We will work with you to provide reasonable accommodations to facilitate your participation and ensure a fair and accessible interview experience. Your request and any information provided will be kept confidential and will not impact your candidacy. We look forward to hearing from you and accommodating your needs to the best of our ability.

Title: Senior Marketing Analyst, Member
Full Description:
About Carrot:
Carrot Fertility is the leading global fertility, family-building, and lifelong hormonal healthcare platform providing care for everyone, everywhere. Trusted by more than a thousand multinational employers, health plans, and health systems, Carrot's comprehensive clinical program delivers industry-leading cost savings for employers and award-winning experiences for millions of people worldwide. From maternity through menopause and pre-pregnancy through parenting, Carrot is dedicated to expanding access and improving outcomes. Carrot empowers members with compassionate, personalized, and inclusive support.
The Role: The Senior Marketing Analyst will serve as the analytics SME on the Growth and Engagement team, responsible for extracting, connecting, and analyzing complex member data across multiple sources (e.g., web, paid and unpaid marketing channels, marketing automation platforms, enterprise data-warehouse) on a formal and ad hoc basis to effectively measure, benchmark, and evaluate the performance of member engagement campaigns, experiments, and other growth initiatives and make recommendations for improvements that will drive increased member engagement and revenue.
Candidates should possess exceptional collaboration and organizational skills, a keen eye for detail to quickly find, escalate, and resolve data discrepancies, and a deep sense of curiosity and creativity to get to the root of what the data is telling us about our members and what we can do as a result of the data to increase conversions across the member journey – from enrollment to engagement to retention. This role will:
Own the marketing member data strategy
Define and maintain team KPIs aligned with achieving business objectives and to identify trends, measure improvements over time, and tell the ROI story
Conduct quality checks and drive continuous improvement in data collection, integration, and accuracy to instill confidence in data integrity among teams
Collaborate with BI, data science, product, and engineering to meet current and future data collection needs that will enable the reliable build-out and delivery of hyper-targeted, personalized member campaigns, and ways to leverage advanced analytics and predictive insights for opportunity sizing and deeper engagement and growth
Mentor team members and contribute to the BI body of knowledge through discussion and documentation
This position combines deep analytical expertise with strategic thinking to help drive meaningful and sustainable member engagement, outcomes, and, importantly, revenue for our business. You will excel as a trusted advisor and creative problem solver and be able to navigate complex problems and processes while delivering well-structured models and rigorous analyses tailored to business needs.
The Team: The Growth and Engagement team consists of high performers dedicated to ensuring employees are aware of the Carrot benefit, how to enroll, and how to maximize its value to drive sustainable and predictable engagement, retention, and revenue. This senior individual contributor role reports directly to the VP of Growth Engagement and operates as an embedded extension of the Business Intelligence team, with close collaboration with Business Intelligence, Marketing Operations, Product, and Engineering.
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative field (statistics, marketing analytics, CS, or related) with a minimum of 5-7 years of relevant experience.
3+ years of hands-on experience with B2C or B2B2C marketing analytics, A/B testing, campaign measurement, and lifecycle optimization across channels like email, SMS, social media, SEM.
Experience in healthcare, tech, and/or health-tech space is a plus.
Familiarity with engagement-based models and strategies and ways your work enabled revenue growth
Proficiency with data warehouse platforms (e.g., Snowflake, AWS), web analytics tools (Google Analytics), paid marketing platforms (Google, Facebook), and marketing automation platforms (Blueshift, Salesforce Marketing Cloud)
Experience with conversion funnel analytics, customer segmentation and personalized targeting strategies.
Working knowledge of Python for data analysis is a plus, not required
Familiarity with advanced analytics, machine learning, and predictive modeling techniques.
Experience using dbt to model, test, and document data.
Advanced knowledge of SQL and ability to write efficient and complex SQL queries.
Experience with statistics concepts and analysis (e.g., hypothesis testing, regression).
Expertise with data visualization software (e.g., Tableau, Domo).
Comfort working with version control systems (Git preferred).
Ability to execute on ambiguously-defined questions and translate business requirements into technical requirements.
Experience with best practices surrounding data governance, data modeling, and data quality.
Excellent organizational skills with the ability to prioritize and adapt in a fast-paced, high-growth environment.
Strong communication and data presentation skills with both marketing and technical teams.
Compensation:
Carrot offers a holistic Total Rewards package designed to support our employees in all aspects of their life inside and outside of work, including health and wellness benefits, retirement savings plans, short- and long-term incentives, parental leave, family-forming assistance, and a competitive compensation package. The starting base salary for this position will range from $140,000.00 - $160,000.00. Actual compensation may vary from posted base salary depending on your confirmed job-related skills and experience.
Fraud Security Notice: Please note that all communication regarding job opportunities at Carrot will come exclusively from an @get-carrot.com email address. If you receive messages from any other domain, please disregard them and report the incident to: securityreporting@get-carrot.com
Why Carrot?
Carrot has received national and international recognition for its pioneering work, including Fast Company's Most Innovative Companies and World Changing Ideas, Inc. Power Partners, and Modern Healthcare’s Innovators. Carrot’s global workforce has been acknowledged with several accolades, including Fortune’s Best Workplaces in Healthcare, Great Place to Work, and Age-Friendly Employer certifications. Carrot is regularly featured in media reporting on issues related to the future of work, women in leadership, and healthcare innovation, including MSNBC, The Economist, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, CNBC, National Public Radio, Harvard Business Review, and more. Learn more at carrotfertility.com.

Title: Principal Software Engineer, Group Tenant Scale
Full Description:
GitLab is an open core software company that develops the most comprehensive AI-powered DevSecOps Platform, used by more than 100,000 organizations. Our mission is to enable everyone to contribute to and co-create the software that powers our world. When everyone can contribute, consumers become contributors, significantly accelerating the rate of human progress. This mission is integral to our culture, influencing how we hire, build products, and lead our industry. We make this possible at GitLab by running our operations on our product and staying aligned with our values. Learn more about Life at GitLab.
Thanks to products like Duo Enterprise, and Duo Workflow, customers get the benefit of AI at every stage of the SDLC. The same principles built into our products are reflected in how our team works: we embrace AI as a core productivity multiplier. All team members are encouraged and expected to incorporate AI into their daily workflows to drive efficiency, innovation, and impact across our global organisation.
An overview of this role
Group Tenant Scale (GTS) is building GitLab’s next generation, multi-tenant, horizontally scalable, resilient SaaS platform, and we want to invite you to become a part of our mission to craft the foundations that enable the rest of our engineering peers and partners to deliver rock-solid features and capabilities to increase our customers’ success. We are looking for a Principal Engineer with a strong distributed systems background and experience in designing, building and operating large-scale cloud systems who can help us deliver on this vision.
Some examples of our projects:
Cells
Organizations
OrgMover
What you’ll do
Technical leader in the design and evolution of GitLab’s multi-tenant platform into distributed systems, from architecture, transition, and operational points of view.
Gain deep knowledge of our product, and customer use cases to guide architecture decisions with availability, reliability, resiliency, performance, and cost in mind.
Provide technical leadership across both infrastructure and development areas,
Take ownership of critical projects, independently driving them to deliver results with the highest levels of quality and efficiency.
Bring creativity and a customer-focused approach to influence the strategic direction of our platforms and product offerings.
Partner and collaborate with engineering, product and leadership teams to ensure alignment on technical, product, and business goals and exceed customer needs and expectations
Foster a strong and healthy engineering culture that focuses on innovation and collaboration, mentoring and guiding engineers at all levels
Specific challenges include backend API design and implementation with built in access control, throttling, and observability, architecting for zero downtime, transparent relocation, and application and infrastructure hardening in a distributed systems environment.
What you’ll bring
Extensive background and strong technical expertise designing, implementing, and running distributed systems at massive scale.
Comfortable with one or more computer programming languages (Ruby, Go)
Production experience with cloud computing
Proven track record of leading large-scale SaaS product architectures and delivering exceptional business outcomes.
Demonstrated ability to mentor senior engineers and elevate team performance.
Adept at balancing high-level business needs with deep technical decisions.
Good communication and ability to work with stakeholders independently
About the team
Group Tenant Scale (GTS) is building GitLab’s next generation, multi-tenant, horizontally scalable, resilient SaaS platform, at both the infrastructure and application layers, through the implementation of Cells and Organizations, respectively, and the extension of Geo to support Organization replication and cross-platform migrations. We aim to provide our customers a rock solid experience with our multi-tenant platform in terms of availability, resilience, scalability, and geolocation, and the mobility to and from our single-tenant offerings as their needs change and evolve, so that their time with us is a journey that helps them achieve their own goals and objectives.
The original team’s projects were, in essence, promoted to dedicated teams, with the addition of Geo to help us build the future of GitLab’s multi-tenant offering.
How GitLab will support you
Benefits to support your health, finances, and well-being
All remote, asynchronous work environment
Flexible Paid Time Off
Team Member Resource Groups
Equity Compensation Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Growth and development budget
Parental leave
Home office support
Please note that we welcome interest from candidates with varying levels of experience; many successful candidates do not meet every single requirement. Additionally, studies have shown that people from underrepresented groups are less likely to apply to a job unless they meet every single qualification. If you're excited about this role, please apply and allow our recruiters to assess your application.
The base salary range for this role’s listed level is currently for residents of listed locations only. Grade level and salary ranges are determined through interviews and a review of education, experience, knowledge, skills, abilities of the applicant, equity with other team members, and alignment with market data. See more information on our benefits and equity. Sales roles are also eligible for incentive pay targeted at up to 100% of the offered base salary.
California/Colorado/Hawaii/New Jersey/New York/Washington/DC/Illinois/Minnesota pay range
$157,900$338,400 USD
Country Hiring Guidelines: GitLab hires new team members in countries around the world. All of our roles are remote, however some roles may carry specific location-based eligibility requirements. Our Talent Acquisition team can help answer any questions about location after starting the recruiting process.
Privacy Policy: Please review our Recruitment Privacy Policy. Your privacy is important to us.
GitLab is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. GitLab’s policies and practices relating to recruitment, employment, career development and advancement, promotion, and retirement are based solely on merit, regardless of race, color, religion, ancestry, sex (including pregnancy, lactation, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression), national origin, age, citizenship, marital status, mental or physical disability, genetic information (including family medical history), discharge status from the military, protected veteran status (which includes disabled veterans, recently separated veterans, active duty wartime or campaign badge veterans, and Armed Forces service medal veterans), or any other basis protected by law. GitLab will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. See also GitLab’s EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know during the recruiting process.

Title: Data Engineer
Full Description:
Founded in 2018 and headquartered in The Netherlands, GT Ecom BV is on a mission to build the most efficient global direct-to-consumer infrastructure and become the world’s largest e-commerce company—powered by a collective of successful, scalable brands. By 2026, we’re aiming to achieve $500 million in revenue and operate over 50 thriving online stores worldwide.
With a team of 160+ top-tier remote e-commerce professionals across the globe, we blend local brand experiences with cross-border logistics, ensuring every customer feels connected—no matter where they are.
At our core, we value hard work, freedom with responsibility, constant improvement, and a mindset of positivity. We believe in building a high-performance, remote-first culture where honesty, excellence, and creativity drive everything we do—because the future of work is global, and we’re building it together.
The Upsides of Working with Us
💪 Hard Work That Matters
We’re surrounded by people who care deeply and give their best. We don’t settle for average—we show up, push boundaries, and aim high. That shared drive creates momentum and meaning in everything we do.
🔓 Freedom with Responsibility
You have the freedom to choose how, when, and where you work—but freedom only thrives when it’s paired with ownership. We trust you to manage your time, meet your commitments, and take responsibility for your impact.
📚 Constant Improvement
Growth is part of our DNA. We believe in learning, evolving, and getting 1% better every day. Whether it’s a new skill, a fresh mindset, or sharper execution—stagnation isn’t in our vocabulary.
🌞 Positivity by Default
We approach people, problems, and communication with a positive mindset. That means giving the benefit of the doubt, staying constructive, and keeping energy high—even when challenges arise.
🗣️ Honesty & Transparency
We believe the fastest way to move forward is through clear, honest communication. No politics. No guessing games. Just straight talk that builds trust and strengthens our team.
🏆 Excellence Is the Baseline
We hold ourselves and each other to a high standard—not out of pressure, but out of pride. We care too much about what we’re building to accept "good enough." Excellence is the expectation.
🎯 Creativity Welcome Here
We encourage bold ideas, fast testing, and open collaboration. Failure doesn’t scare us—comfort does. That’s why creativity is valued as a core ingredient in everything from product to process.
We’re on the lookout for a Data Engineer to help us drive growth by turning messy eCommerce data into clean, actionable insights and scalable dashboards!
The Challenge
As our eCommerce business continues to grow, so does the complexity and volume of our data. We’re looking for a Data Engineer who can take ownership of building and maintaining our data infrastructure—ensuring our dashboards are automated, scalable, and delivering insights we can trust. This role is critical to help us unlock smarter decision-making across marketing, sales, and operations.
Day In the Life of a Data Engineer at GT Ecom
Build and optimize data pipelines to collect, process, and store data from platforms like Shopify, Google Ads, Meta, Klaviyo, and other marketing/sales tools.
Design and maintain our data warehouse architecture (BigQuery, Snowflake, or similar).
Collaborate with analysts, marketers, and developers to ensure data is accessible, clean, and trustworthy.
Implement data quality checks, automated alerts, and ETL/ELT pipelines.
Integrate third-party APIs and automate data reporting processes.
Enable scalable dashboards and support self-service analytics using tools like Looker, Tableau, or Power BI.
Early Success Milestones for this role
You improved existing dashboards and built new, more advanced dashboards that enabled better decision-making.
You automated data flows, eliminated manual reporting, and helped the team act faster on clean and accurate data.
You helped structure our data foundation for long-term scalability and team-wide accessibility.
Your Team When You Join Us
You’ll report directly to our COO and collaborate closely with our marketing, tech, and analytics teams to support data-driven decisions across the business.
We would love to hear from you if…
You have previous experience in similar role
You have strong experience in data analytics and business intelligence in a fast-paced environment.
You are proficient in SQL and cloud data warehouses (e.g., BigQuery, Redshift, Snowflake).
You are skilled in Python for building ETL pipelines and automation.
You are familiarity with eCommerce data sources like Shopify, GA4, Meta Ads, Google Ads, and Klaviyo.
You are experienced with data orchestration tools such as Airflow, dbt, or similar is a strong plus.
You are proactive—you enjoy improving systems before they're broken and making sense of messy data.
Couple of the notes about the role
This is not a salaried position. This is an Independent Contractor role.
You must be able to commit at least 8 hours per day, 40 hours per week. Schedule is negotiable.
We require everybody in the team to use Hubstaff (https://hubstaff.com/) to track hours worked.
Compensation
EUR 13.90 - 18.50 per hour + performance bonus + EUR 75/month reimbursable health stipend
If you are excited about the opportunity and feel like you are a good fit, we encourage you to apply today and talk to one of our recruiters. We look forward to seeing how your skills and experiences align with our vision.

Title: Senior Infrastructure Engineer
Full Description:
About Us
Zora is a new kind of on-chain social network where you can express yourself freely, connect with others, and discover the value of your imagination. We believe that by using crypto, we can enable a more equitable system for creators, fundamentally rediscovering the power of the internet.
We’re working tirelessly to make Zora available to as many people as possible with a simple, fun, and rewarding consumer app. Our mission is to make creating on the internet free and valuable.
Who we're looking for
Zora is looking for experienced senior infrastructure engineers to work closely with the development team to ensure that the infrastructure meets the needs of the business and is scalable and highly available, including indexer service, API, data pipeline, disaster recovery, and other blockchain-related project support.
Examples of software at Zora
An RPC proxy that intelligently routes blockchain traffic between in-house and vendor nodes, ensuring data consistency, improving our reliability
A platform that reduces friction for engineers to deploy, monitor, and manage production code
Our highly performant in-house Kubernetes cluster running on bare metal servers
The Zora RPC service, surfacing blockchain data for our core indexing infra
What You’ll Do
Design, build, and deliver software to enhance the availability, scalability, latency, and efficiency of Zora’s infrastructure platform.
Provide technical and strategic input to shape the direction of the infrastructure platform.
Operate and maintain core infrastructure systems in service of enhancing the developer experience.
Automate key infrastructure workflows, including service lifecycle management and critical operational processes.
Participate in the team’s on-call rotation and respond to production incidents as needed.
Skills We’re Looking For
Proficiency in Go (preferred) or Python.
Experience designing large-scale systems, breaking down complex problems, and aligning with cross-functional engineering teams.
Familiarity with blockchain infrastructure, including RPC nodes and IPFS.
Strong experience with database technologies such as MongoDB and Postgres.
Solid understanding of monitoring and observability practices using tools like Datadog and/or OpenTelemetry.
Strong debugging and troubleshooting skills, from orchestration layers down to system runtimes.
Clear and effective communication skills, with a collaborative and service-oriented mindset.
Nice to Have
5+ years of experience in infrastructure and/or platform engineering, with a focus on software development.
Hands-on experience with Kubernetes or similar orchestration systems.
Operational experience with distributed storage systems like Ceph.
Familiarity with Python’s asyncio programming model.
Experience with frontend serverless platforms like Vercel, Cloudflare Pages Functions, etc.
Understanding of Ethereum and EVM-compatible chains, including L2 architectures like Polygon, Optimism, and Base.
Knowledge of L2 scaling solutions such as optimistic rollups, zk-rollups, Plasma, sidechains, and bridges.
Passion for learning and exploring new technologies and paradigms.
Benefits
Zora provides top quality medical, dental, and vision insurance, with a flexible time-off policy, equity, and additional company perks (including stipends for: LD, internet/phone bill, Ease of Life, and more!).
Values
Move fast
Endlessly curious
A love for the big little details
A willingness to experiment and be bold
Do your best work
Location
While Zora’s headquarters are the internet, we have an office located in New York City and have employees all over the world.

Title: Principal Infrastructure Engineer
Full Description:
Engine is the modern travel platform for booking and managing work trips. It saves businesses time and money through an intuitive travel network that connects to nearly every hotel, airline, and car rental company in the U.S. It offers single invoice billing, the flexibility to modify trips at any time without sunk costs, and a unified view of all company travel and spend. Customers rely on Engine to not only make travel easier to manage, but to make it enjoyable for everyone involved. The company is backed by Telescope Partners, Blackstone, Elefund and Permira. Learn more at www.engine.com.
Your Mission:
The Engine Infrastructure and Security (InfraSec) group is working to provide a cloud ecosystem where building new services and environments is automatic and economical for the business, and creates leverage, velocity, and quality for our engineers. As a Principal Infrastructure Engineer, you will be the force multiplier that helps build the technical roadmap, sets the overall architectural direction, solves the most difficult problems, and provides technical guidance to the InfraSec engineering team. You will be responsible for defining how we standardize, automate, and deliver the next generation of cloud environments, infrastructure, build/deploy, and ecosystem services.
What You’ll Bring to Engine:We’re looking for someone who’s ready to make an impact and grow alongside us:
Experience: 12+ years of hands-on experience in designing and building scalable, reliable cloud infrastructure and systems. Deep expertise in cloud environments and services, particularly AWS. Proven ability to define and drive technical direction across teams, navigate technical and business ambiguity, and develop a compelling roadmap. Strong communication skills with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts, align stakeholders, and secure buy-in from leadership and partners. Experience leading and executing large-scale infrasec initiatives in complex technical ecosystems, ensuring long-term scalability, resilience, and efficiency.

Technical Skillset:
Infrastructure as Code: Mastery of Terraform, as well as multiple declarative and imperative frameworks (ex: Cloudformation, Chef, Puppet, Ansible, Pulumi)
Containerization: Strong experience with Docker and Kubernetes
Observability: Expertise in logging, monitoring, metrics, and alerting systems
Configuration Management & Service Discovery: Deep understanding of data organization, partitioning, storage and retrieval, fault tolerance, and leveraging effective libraries for automation and orchestration
CI/CD: Proficiency in tools and architectures for build, deploy, and artifact management
Security & Compliance: Experience with security systems, data governance, and compliance frameworks.
Mindset: Strategic thinker who thrives in ambiguous environments and can define a clear technical vision. Collaborative leader who can communicate technical concepts effectively to stakeholders. Passion for building scalable, reliable, and secure infrastructure with a continuous improvement mindset. A hands-on technical leader who thrives on driving teams through complex challenges and delivering impactful results.
Cash compensation: The base salary range for this role is $220,000 to $250,000. Final compensation packages are determined by various factors, including prior experience and expertise. This role is also eligible to receive equity compensation.
The Engine Edge: Perks & CompensationWe believe in rewarding great work with great benefits:
Compensation: Competitive base pay tied to role and experience, with opportunities for bonuses, commissions, and equity.
Benefits: Check out our full list atengine.com/culture.
Environments for Success: Different roles have different needs in terms of the environments that drive success which is why we have a hybrid-hub model. Whether you are in one of our amazing offices or fully remote, we’ll make sure you have what you need to succeed.
Perks and benefits may vary based on employment type, location, and more.
Ready to Build the Future of Work Travel?Join us on our mission to transform how work travel works—for businesses, for travelers, and for the industry. Apply now and let’s make travel simpler, smarter, and more enjoyable—together.

Title: PAID MEDIA SENIOR
Full Description:
Este es un puesto de trabajo remoto.
El Paid Media deberá liderar la estrategia de medios, gestionando campañas de adquisición y retención en diversas plataformas (Meta, Google, YouTube, TikTok, Pinterest, Twitter, Programática, entre otras).

El objetivo es maximizar el retorno de inversión y contribuir a la activación y fidelización de usuarios.


Responsabilidades


Desarrollar y ejecutar planes de medios alineados a los objetivos de marketing, comunicación y crecimiento.

Implementar, monitorear y optimizar el rendimiento de campañas en plataformas como Meta Ads, Google Ads, YouTube, TikTok Ads, Twitter Ads, y otras relevantes.

Realizar pruebas A/B y experimentación para optimizar resultados.

Generar reportes semanales sobre adquisición y retención de usuarios, destacando KPIs.

Gestionar presupuestos de campañas y maximizar el rendimiento, ajustando en tiempo real según los resultados.

Colaborar con otros equipos (Producto, Diseño, etc.) para garantizar la coherencia de las campañas.

Enfoque tanto en performance como en branding, con habilidades de negociación y análisis de datos.

Gestionar relaciones con proveedores y plataformas de publicidad.

Analizar datos de mercado y audiencia para identificar las mejores plataformas y canales para las campañas b2c, b2b, y b2b2c.
Colaborar con equipos creativos y de marketing para asegurar que los mensajes publicitarios estén alineados con la estrategia general de la marca.

Realizar estudios post-campaña para evaluar la efectividad de las estrategias de medios y proporcionar informes detallados.
Mantenerse actualizado(a) sobre las tendencias del mercado y las nuevas tecnologías en publicidad y medios.


Requisitos

Más de 3 años de experiencia en gestión e implementación de medios como Media Planner, Paid Media o un puesto similar.

Capacidad para trabajar en múltiples proyectos simultáneamente y cumplir con los plazos establecidos.

Buscamos a alguien que no solo ejecute, sino que proponga, cuestione y lleve nuestras campañas a otro nivel.

Excelentes habilidades de redacción y comunicación.

Dominio Intermedio o Avanzado de herramientas de análisis y planificación de medios (Microsoft Excel, Google Sheets, Google Analytics, Adwords, Meta Business, Look Studio, entre otras).

Deseables

Experiencia en Fintech o banca.

Conocimientos en Notion


Ventajas
15 días hábiles libres remunerados.
Feriados del país.
Cuenta con plan de formación interno y externo (platzi).
Día del cumpleaños libre.
5 días administrativos.

Title: Presales Manager
Full Description:
Deine Aufgaben
About Hypatos
Hypatos is a leading B2B SaaS company revolutionizing back-office operations with AI-powered document processing solutions. Positioned between Series A and Series B, Hypatos is scaling rapidly and enabling enterprises to transform their finance operations with advanced automation. Our presales team plays a critical role in delivering tailored solutions that address the unique needs of our customers, making it a cornerstone of our sales success.

Role Overview
We are seeking an experienced Presales Manager to lead and manage a high-performing team of Solution Consultants and Presales Support Engineers. The Presales Manager will oversee the portfolio of presales projects, ensuring high-quality delivery across demos, proof-of-concepts (POCs), and RFP responses. While managing the overall presales portfolio, the Presales Manager will take an active role in complex and innovative projects, collaborating closely with the AI Innovation Engineering team to develop and deliver cutting-edge solutions.
This role requires strong leadership capabilities, deep domain expertise in finance and ERP systems (especially SAP), and the ability to drive both operational efficiency and innovation in presales processes.

Key Responsibilities
Team Leadership and Management
Lead, mentor, and develop a team of Solution Consultants and Presales Support Engineers, fostering a culture of collaboration and excellence.
Oversee the portfolio of presales projects, ensuring resources are allocated effectively to meet deadlines and customer expectations.
Provide guidance and coaching to team members to enhance their technical expertise and customer-facing skills.
Active Involvement in Complex and Innovative Projects
Take direct ownership of high-stakes and innovative presales projects, working hands-on with customers and internal teams.
Collaborate with the AI Innovation Engineering team to design and develop custom solutions for unique and complex use cases.
Act as the primary point of contact for customers on these projects, ensuring successful delivery and alignment with customer needs.
Presales Strategy and Execution
Define and implement presales processes, ensuring consistency, efficiency, and scalability across the team.
Oversee the preparation and delivery of demos, RFPs, and POCs, ensuring they meet the highest standards of quality and customer relevance.
Drive the standardization and automation of presales activities, particularly in the setup of demo and test environments.

Domain Expertise in Finance and ERPs
Serve as a subject matter expert in finance automation, document processing, and ERP integration, with a strong focus on SAP.
Guide the team in leveraging domain expertise to design tailored solutions that address customer challenges.
Stay informed on industry trends and emerging technologies to keep Hypatos at the forefront of innovation.
Customer Engagement and Collaboration
Support the sales team in customer-facing engagements, particularly for strategic and high-value opportunities.
Build strong relationships with key stakeholders to ensure alignment on customer requirements and expectations.
Act as an escalation point for technical challenges in both standard and complex presales projects.
Cross-Functional Collaboration
Partner with sales, product, and engineering teams to align presales activities with Hypatos’ product roadmap and go-to-market strategy.
Collaborate with the AI Innovation Engineering team to translate customer challenges into innovative product features and solutions.
Provide feedback to the product team based on insights gained from presales engagements.
Performance Tracking and Reporting
Define and monitor key performance metrics (KPIs) for the presales team, including customer satisfaction, pipeline support, and POC success rates.
Provide regular updates to senior leadership on presales performance, challenges, and opportunities for improvement.
Dein Profil
Presales Leadership: 7+ years of experience in presales or solution consulting, with at least 3 years in a leadership role managing technical teams.
Domain Expertise: Strong knowledge of finance automation, document processing, and ERP systems, with a deep understanding of SAP integrations.
Technical Skills: Familiarity with AI-powered automation solutions, workflow automation, and cloud technologies (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud).
Innovation Mindset: Proven ability to collaborate on and deliver innovative solutions in partnership with engineering teams.
Customer Focus: Strong ability to engage with enterprise customers, understand their needs, and design tailored solutions.
Process Optimization: Experience in standardizing and automating presales processes, including demo and POC preparation.
Analytical Skills: Ability to use data and insights to track team performance, identify areas for improvement, and make informed decisions.
Communication Skills: Exceptional verbal and written communication skills for interacting with customers, internal teams, and leadership.
Education: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Finance, or a related field; MBA is a plus.

Preferred Skills
Experience with other major ERP systems (e.g., Oracle, Workday, Coupa).
Familiarity with natural language AI and automation workflows.
Exposure to global enterprise sales cycles and multi-market presales management.

What We Offer
Competitive salary with performance-based incentives.
Equity options to participate in Hypatos’ growth journey.
Opportunity to lead and shape a world-class presales team in a high-growth SaaS environment.
A collaborative, innovative, and mission-driven work environment.
Hybrid work flexibility with opportunities for travel.

Location
Flexible across Europe, with occasional travel to customer locations and Hypatos’ headquarters.

Application Process
If you are passionate about leading high-performing teams and have deep expertise in presales, finance, ERP solutions, and driving innovation, we want to hear from you. Submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and vision for this role.

Hypatos is an equal-opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive and innovative workplace.
Unser Versprechen
We trust amazing people to do amazing things and make a long-term impact - we give you Freedom and ownership of meaningful work that directly impacts the business
Beyond a top market compensation, you will enjoy a unlimited vacation days, professional development activities, meal allowance, sporting activities and free beers as well as a hybrid working mode
We're building a positive organizational culture where personal and professional growth are just as important as business growth
We believe different perspectives make Hypatos a better community - that is why we're committed to building a diverse and inclusive environment where you feel you belong

Title: 872 - Virtual Assistant (Real Estate Sales & Operations)
Full Description:
We Make Remote Work Remarkable • TopTalent from LatAm
Hello! We are GoFasti, a Talent-as-a-Service. GoFasti bridges the gap between world-class developers and designers from LatAm and first-class companies around the globe.
We need an English-fluent PART-TIMEVirtual Assistant (Real Estate Sales & Operations), based in Latin America, available to work remotely.

Are you the one we are looking for?
